channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Congress faces tight deadline to fund DHS. And, Ryan Routh faces sentencing
item.description: Congress ended the shutdown, but now faces a tight deadline to fund the Department of Homeland Security. And, the man convicted of attempting to assassinate Trump faces sentencing today.
item.content:encoded:
Congress ended the shutdown, but now faces a tight deadline to fund the Department of Homeland Security. And, the man convicted of attempting to assassinate Trump faces sentencing today.

(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: How a Black fossil digger became a superstar in the very white world of paleontology
item.description: In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.
item.content:encoded:
In South Africa, paleontology has been dominated by white people. Lazarus Kgasi is changing that dynamic — and coloring in the picture of the world our distant ancestors once inhabited.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: At retirement's edge, homebuying math gets harder. Here's how to navigate it
item.description: How old is too old for a 30-year mortgage? It's just one of a number of questions that older Americans face when they are looking to buy a home later in life.
item.content:encoded:
How old is too old for a 30-year mortgage? It's just one of a number of questions that older Americans face when they are looking to buy a home later in life.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Trump grants tariff breaks to 'politically connected' companies, Senate Dems say
item.description: The White House's trade policy has "opened the door to corruption," according to a letter from Ron Wyden and Chris Van Hollen.
item.content:encoded:
The White House's trade policy has "opened the door to corruption," according to a letter from Ron Wyden and Chris Van Hollen.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Israel strikes Gaza, killing 19, mostly women and children, after saying Hamas violated deal
item.description: They are the latest Palestinians in Gaza to die since a ceasefire deal, which has been punctuated by deadly Israeli strikes, came into effect on Oct. 10, 2025.
item.content:encoded:
They are the latest Palestinians in Gaza to die since a ceasefire deal, which has been punctuated by deadly Israeli strikes, came into effect on Oct. 10, 2025.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Here's looking at you, kid: How the term for a young goat made the leap to children
item.description: Kid, meaning a young goat, is a word that was borrowed from the Vikings around the 9th century. Centuries later, it came to mean a child and a teasing joke.
item.content:encoded:
Kid, meaning a young goat, is a word that was borrowed from the Vikings around the 9th century. Centuries later, it came to mean a child and a teasing joke.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Will calls to 'abolish ICE' sway voters in 2026? The strategy has Democrats split
item.description: The Trump administration's immigration efforts have led some Democrats to call for abolishing ICE. Others won't go as far, wary of appearing out of step with voters who want immigration laws enforced.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's immigration efforts have led some Democrats to call for abolishing ICE. Others won't go as far, wary of appearing out of step with voters who want immigration laws enforced.

(Image credit: Jim Vondruska)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: You owe it to yourself to go on a solo trip. Here's how to plan one
item.description: Traveling on your own can be scary, but it can be one of the most meaningful things you can do for yourself. Three solo travelers share their experiences — and what makes for a successful trip.
item.content:encoded: Traveling on your own can be scary, but it can be one of the most meaningful things you can do for yourself. Three solo travelers share their experiences — and what makes for a successful trip.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Edelman

item.title: As Trump pushes for Venezuela's oil, here's what to know about the U.S. and Iraq's oil
item.description: Oil analysts who worked in Iraq say Iraqi oil sales had more protections after the U.S. invasion than Venezuelan oil sales today.
item.content:encoded:
Oil analysts who worked in Iraq say Iraqi oil sales had more protections after the U.S. invasion than Venezuelan oil sales today.

(Image credit: Qassem Zein)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: A photographer will achieve a milestone record at Super Bowl LX
item.description: When Super bowl 60 gets underway there will be one photographer on the sidelines who has snapped shots at every Super Bowl game. John Biever was 15 when he took photos at the first Super Bowl; he says this one will likely be his last.
item.content:encoded:
When Super bowl 60 gets underway there will be one photographer on the sidelines who has snapped shots at every Super Bowl game. John Biever was 15 when he took photos at the first Super Bowl; he says this one will likely be his last.

(Image credit: Greg Echlin)
item.dc:creator: Greg Echlin
